'''New Washington''' is a borough in [[Clearfield County, Pennsylvania|Clearfield County]], [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States]]. The population was 59 at the 2010 census. ==Geography== New Washington is located at {{coord|40|49|22|N|78|42|4|W|type:city}} (40.822783, -78.701112){{GR|1}}. According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the borough has a total area of {{convert|2.2|sqmi|km2}}, all of it land. ==Demographics== {{Historical populations | type=USA | 2000|89 | 2010|59 }} As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 89 people, 30 households, and 26 families residing in the borough. The [[population density]] was 41.2 people per square mile (15.9/km²). There were 43 housing units at an average density of 19.9 per square mile (7.7/km²). The racial makeup of the borough was 97.75% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]] and 2.25% [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]]. There were 30 households out of which 46.7% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 76.7% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 6.7% had a female householder with no husband present, and 13.3% were non-families. 13.3% of all households were made up of individuals and 10.0% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.97 and the average family size was 3.27. In the borough the population was spread out with 31.5% under the age of 18, 4.5% from 18 to 24, 30.3% from 25 to 44, 19.1% from 45 to 64, and 14.6% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 38 years. For every 100 females there were 117.1 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 103.3 males. The median income for a household in the borough was $22,500, and the median income for a family was $26,250. Males had a median income of $26,563 versus $13,750 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the borough was $9,121. There were no families and 3.2% of the population living below the [[poverty line]], including no under eighteens and 22.2% of those over 64. ==Notable residents== *[[James W. Mott]], [[United States House of Representatives|U.S. Representative]] from [[Oregon]] 1933-1945 ==References== <references /> {{Clearfield County, Pennsylvania}} [[Category:Populated places established in 1859]] [[Category:Boroughs in Clearfield County, Pennsylvania]]
